content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here's how you can create such a function:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    blocks = split(md, "```julia")
    cleaned_blocks = [join(split("```julia"*b), '\n') for b in blocks[2:end]] # skip first block as it doesn't contain code
    return join(cleaned_blocks, "\n\n")
end
```
This function splits the markdown string into blocks using "```julia" as a separator. It then cleans each of these blocks by removing "```julia" at the start and end and joining all lines with newline character. Finally it joins all cleaned code blocks together with double newlines to get the desired output.

Please note that this function assumes that there is exactly one code block for every "```julia". If the markdown document has multiple code blocks separated by different language markers (like "```python", "```bash"), you'll need a more complex solution.
